subtasks: Insert combine's bucket into the cab
Sit in the driver's seat
Start the combine's engine
Adjust the combine's speed
Guide the combine over the crop rows
Operate the combine's hydraulic systems
Monitor combine's performance
Communicate with another person to discuss combine performance
Move the disc up or down on the arm
Tighten the nuts securing the disc
Align the disc with crop rows
Attend a meeting with neighbors
Align combines on ground crew's trucks
Transport combines to the field
Greet attendees at a meeting
Discuss logistics and preparations for the harvest (e.g., combine readiness, disc adjustment)
Coordinate with fellow farmers
Position the disc in front of the tractor
Engage the disc's clutch
Start the disc's power take-off (PTO)
Adjust the disc's angle or depth
Monitor the disc's operation
Communicate with another person about disc adjustments
Boards or other loading equipment
Carefully load combine onto a truck
Secure the combine with straps or chains
Transport the combine to the field
Unload the combine from the truck onto prepared ground

tasks.task: ** Participate in a meeting for harvest coordination
subtasks: Attend a meeting with other farmers
Discuss plans for the harvest
Coordinate equipment usage, timing, and crop handling
Make decisions regarding the harvest schedule
Monitor combine's operation during harvest
Note any inefficiencies or issues
Communicate findings to operator

tasks.task: ** Check pressure of other field's tires
subtasks: Approach a field with a tractor or vehicle
Locate the tires to check pressure
Use a gauge to measure tire pressure
Compare the measured pressure with the recommended level
Adjust tire pressure if necessary (add or release air)
Ensure all tires are properly inflated
Inspect a disc for wear or damage
Clean the disc blades
Tighten any loose bolts or nuts
Check disc's alignment and movement
Engage the hydraulic system
Lubricate the disc mechanism if needed
Ensure combines are lined up straight in the field
Guide the equipment into a straight line
Check distance between each machine to maintain proper spacing

tasks.task: ** Communicate with others during field setup
subtasks: Coordinate with neighbors or fellow farmers to line up combines
Use gestures or hand signals for alignment
Verbal communication about equipment adjustments or positions

tasks.task: ** Monitor field in front of combine
subtasks: Observe the row in front of the combine's moving path
Look for obstructions or poor disc operation (e.g., uneven cutting)
Note any adjustments needed for equipment (e.g., disc set)

The user requested "physical tasks a person would have to perform" based on the video transcript, so tasks related to operation, maintenance, planning, and real-time adjustments are included. The transcript details a meeting about harvest preparation, operating combines and discs, equipment transportation, and scheduling. Therefore, the tasks are derived from these contexts, focusing on driving, maintaining, and coordinating agricultural machinery. The combine-related tasks are listed under driving, while equipment adjustment and meet coordination are separate entries.
